conclusion: Points O, A, and B all lie on the same straight line that passes through the origin; therefore the gas follows V ∝ T (i.e. V/T is constant).
For point B the coordinates read directly from the graph are V_B = 0.60 m³, T_B = 300 K.
V_B / T_B = 0.60 m³ / 300 K = 2.0 × 10⁻³ m³ K⁻¹. This ratio is the constant V/T for every state on that line, including state A.
State A is shown at V_A = 0.40 m³.
Temperature at state A T_A = 200 K
